text: Has anyone seen this effort before? I really like the idea of a JSON ish format that has a corresponding binary format (and also cleans up some other issues JSON has). <https://concise-encoding.org/>

attachments.title: Concise Encoding
attachments.text: The friendly data format for human and machine. Think JSON, but with 1:1 compatible twin binary and text formats, and rich type support.

elements.text: Has anyone seen this effort before? I really like the idea of a JSON ish format that has a corresponding binary format (and also cleans up some other issues JSON has).

attachments.title: Standards
attachments.text: [Title text] "Fortunately, the charging one has been solved now that we've all standardized on mini-USB. Or is it micro-USB? Shit."

text: You mean like BSON or messagepack or UBJSON or BJSON?

elements.text: You mean like BSON or messagepack or UBJSON or BJSON?

text: Among those it seems UBJSON is the only one that is directly comparable in that it has a cononical representation in both binary and text formats. That is the feature that makes this effort stand out to me. (I work in an environment with a bunch of folks who refuse to store data as any format that they can't open with notepad and it causes us no end of trouble, a format that is "readable" but has a concise representation would be very helpful. But I also completely recognize (<@U6A936746>) that it's never going to take off because of that issue. Just unfortunate. I fear I'll be stuck with weird hand craft text files designed by my colleagues in the 90s forever.
